bibl.title: Letter from Archibald Malloch to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1942

div1.p: Malloch sends Hench notes concerning the New York Academy of Medicine's acquisition of Walter Reed's notebook on the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Archibald Malloch to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1942
div1.opener:
THE NEW YORK ACADEMY OF MEDICINE
2 EAST 103RD STREET
NEW YORK
15 January 1942
Library
Telephone ATwater 9-4700
Cable: “Nyacadmed”
Dr. P. S. Hench
Hotel Willard
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I enjoyed your visit and your enthusiasm
the other day very much.

I enclose a copy of what we have put in
the laboratory notebook, leaving out, as I
explained to you, certain names. I shall try to
find out whether more such things are procurable.

It would be very good of you if some day
we might have your opinion about exactly what
is in the laboratory book and whose hands are
shown there.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, Archibald Malloch, M.D.
Librarian AM:D
Encl.
